author: Jennifer Bennett
title: Chicago Vanquishes Cops’ Vaccine-Report Religious Bias Claims
text: Chicago is free of a religious discrimination suit stemming from its Covid-19 vaccine mandate after a federal judge ruled more than a dozen police officers failed to allege the city’s policy violated their rights. The officers argued that the vaccine mandate represented an unconstitutional violation of the First Amendment’s free exercise protection as applied to them, but they didn’t identify any religious reason for their failures to report their shot status to the city, the US District Court for the Northern District of Illinois [said](https://www.bloomberglaw.com/public/document/KondilisvCityofChicagoNo23C22492024BL177555NDIllMay232024CourtOpi?doc_id=X1MG26OEG000N) Thursday, dismissing the suit with prejudice.
